intro: Styphelia remota, commonly known as the remote styphelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This evergreen shrub typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its small, white flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch to its foliage. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and needle-like leaves.
